markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 9"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Self-Emptying Pocket](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1656)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Contract" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=329" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 165</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

You never perform to an empty crowd after promising any profits to a phantom in a playhouse, sealed by holes that appear in your pockets. By meeting with the attendees at your events, you can use [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) instead of [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) to [Gather Information](/Actions.aspx?ID=49). When you would use Performance to [Earn Income](/Actions.aspx?ID=23), you don't earn any gold pieces, as the money disappears before you can even count it.

 The entity that holds your _bargained contract_ can influence your reception any time you perform for a crowd or Activate the pocket. If they influence your performance favorably, you gain a +2 item bonus to your Performance check. If they influence your performance unfavorably, you gain a -2 item penalty to your Performance check. If you've failed to earn the entity money in quite a while, it typically influences your performance unfavorably.

<document level="2" id="action-1256" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Self-Emptying Pocket
